entry.title: Linux packaging letter
entry.summary: The quoted response from Scott Howard addresses the issue of certifying Debian libraries and testing architectures for bitcoind/bitcoin-qt. The author of the initial message expresses skepticism towards the need for this certification, given that maintainers often deal with similar issues. However, they also criticize the negligent practice of packaging big endian binaries. The author acknowledges the point made by Scott Howard and concedes that certification may be necessary after all.
